definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Proper sealing and protection of material carton after usage or opening by IQC or warehouse operator.
sentences.chinese: IQC或倉管員開箱或取用物料後正確封箱和保護。

sentences.english: That video is part of a larger phenomenon on the Web called " unboxing ."
sentences.chinese: 這個視頻是更廣泛的網上“開箱”現象的組成部分。

sentences.english: You can dispatch your representative to join the openpackage inspection, if you like.
sentences.chinese: 你方願意的話也可派代表參加開箱檢查。

sentences.english: When unpacking the case, we found the colour unsatisfactory.
sentences.chinese: 開箱後，我方發現顏色不令人滿意。

sentences.english: On unwrapping the cases, we found the goods partly soaked by rain.
sentences.chinese: 開箱後，發現部分貨物因雨淋受溼。

sentences.english: It should use two steel lines and steel tube cover tope of frame to suspend if open box.
sentences.chinese: 開箱吊運時用二條鋼絲繩和鋼管套在底架頂環中起吊。

sentences.english: The Lins moved into their new home and began to unpack .
sentences.chinese: 林家搬進他們的新家，並且開始開箱整理。

sentences.english: It shall be used up after opening the box. Don't be exposed to atmosphere in long time.
sentences.chinese: 開箱後應一次使用完畢，不得長時間暴露於空氣中。

sentences.english: A set of predefined patterns, ready to deploy out of the box.
sentences.chinese: 一組預先定義的模式，可以開箱即用地部署。

sentences.english: Created by Salvatore Calabrese, this is a great example of out-of-the-box thinking.
sentences.chinese: 由薩爾瓦託雷創建，這是一個開箱即用很好的例子。

definition: to order goods/to place an order
to divide into portions/to package in smaller quantities/to separate into loads
to place an order/to order/an order (of goods)
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to dismantle/to disassemble/to open up (sth sealed)/to unpick
